titleStmt.title: John C. Bobin et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8710

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Jamestown Ky
February 20th 1863
To his Excellency Govenor Roberson

Sir There has been two fines assessed in the Russell Circuit Court against John G Stanton of said County for Gaming amounting to $61.05 and$20 each at June Term 1860 We the undersigned Citizens and neigbors of said Stanton Petition to your Excellency for the purpose of having all of said fines remitted excepting that part ^one^ the Atty for the Commonwealth Executions are in the hands of the Sheriff, at this time for coercing the payment of said fines. Mr Stanton is a poor man and regarded by all his neighbors as being strictly honest and We are satisfied that he is not able to pay said fines without making a sacrifice that will greatly injure himself and prehaps cause great distress in his family

John C Bobin
Wm Lucas
W, T, Jackman S. R. C
S J Collins
George Bryan
J A Williams Co Atto
G. B, Warren
Berry Barnett
Wm H Casteel
Jesse Wooldridge
A. Wooldrege
Davis Chamberlain
G P Eubank
J Skull
Fleming
Samuel Smith
Rhodes Powell
Tarter
Jonas Smith
William Stanton
Martin Stanton
Wesley Bell

N B The return day of the Executions which is now in the hands of the Sheriff is the 1st Monday in March and it will require immediate action upon this subject to do the Petitioner any good consequently I will expect speedy action upon the within subject

p.hi: I am well acquainted with the Petitioner M. Stanton and think that the foregoing fines ought to be remitted to do his family Justice I Co Atty

body.p:
Russell Cir Ct
Remitted
J F Robinson
$20
2 fines } Mis --
Jno. G. Stanton
Issd Mar. 4. 1863.
